sentences.en: Graff was not so amenable to Vision and Ideals as usual.
sentences.cn: 格拉夫不象往常那样顺从远见和理想.

sentences.en: He is not amenable to reason.
His scientific discoveries are amenable to the laws of physics.
sentences.cn: 他在科学上的发现经得起物理定律的检验.

sentences.en: I never had a long-term relationship as I wasn't good enough, or interesting or amenable enough.
sentences.cn: 因为我不够优秀，不够有趣或者不够亲切，所以恋爱关系从来都维持不长。

sentences.en: She was always a very amenable child.
sentences.cn: 她一向是个很听话的孩子。

sentences.en: She'll be amenable to any sensible suggestions.
sentences.cn: 任何合理的建议她都会接受的.

sentences.en: The child could not be made amenable to rules.
sentences.cn: 这孩子根本不懂得循规蹈矩.

sentences.en: The Jordanian leader seemed amenable to attending a conference.
sentences.cn: 约旦领导人似乎愿意参加会议。

sentences.en: These data are amenable to checking.
They had three very amenable children.
sentences.cn: 他们有三个很听话的孩子。

sentences.en: They had three very amenable children.
sentences.cn: 他们有三个很听话的孩子。

sentences.en: Those two are not amenable to anything I can say.
sentences.cn: 我不管怎样说,那两个也是不买帐的.

sentences.en: To some extent the differences were amenable to argument.
sentences.cn: 这些分歧在某种程度上可以通过辩论来克服.

sentences.en: We are all amenable to the law.
sentences.cn: 我们全都是对这法律负责的.

sentences.en: We are amenable to the law [ to discipline ].
sentences.cn: 我们应该服从法律 [ 有遵守纪律的义务 ].

words.tran_cn: 有责任的，应服从的；有义务的；经得起检验的

trans.tran_cn: （对法律等）负责的，易控制的，经得起检验（或考查）的，可用某种方式处理的
trans.tran_en: willing to accept what someone says or does without arguing
